rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0001
rows.name: That looks like a good one!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0002
rows.name:
Meh meh! Fur always stand on
end whenever Tora see Driver
resonate with crystal. So cool!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0003
rows.name:
Hey, don't look at me like that, you're
making me feel weird!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0004
rows.name:
Well, looks like we've got a new
recruit, anyway. Let's go and find out
what happened to Nia!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0005
rows.name: Rex... Not so fast!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0006
rows.name: Huh? What's up?

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0007
rows.name:
Aren't you going to kit your new
Blade out...?

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0008
rows.name:
You can tune up the weapon with a
Core Chip from that smithy there.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0009
rows.name:
If boss never use Core Chip before
then now very good time to start!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0010
rows.name:
You can really tell the difference
between a Driver who uses Core Chips
and one who doesn't...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0011
rows.name: I'm starting to understand...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0012
rows.name: Now for the main topic...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0013
rows.name: That over there is an Aux Core Shop.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0014
rows.name:
I don't suppose you had a lot of call to
go in there before you became a Driver!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0015
rows.name: You're right about that...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0016
rows.name:
I used to wonder what all that strange
gear was for, though...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0017
rows.name:
Perhaps we should head over and
give it a try, then!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0101
rows.name:
Aux Cores are just the thing for
supplementing a Blade's power.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0102
rows.name:
There all different types! Some boost
defense, some make strong against
insects, or stronger at night-time, meh!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0103
rows.name:
The number of Aux Cores you can
equip varies from Blade to Blade, mind.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0104
rows.name: Interesting stuff...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0105
rows.name:
Now, this is the important part,
so listen up.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0106
rows.name:
Usually when you get an Aux Core, it's
in an empty state. You won't boost
your Blade with it empty!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0107
rows.name: Okay. So how do you fix that then?

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0108
rows.name: Huh... I see!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0109
rows.name:
So this gizmo here makes Aux Cores
usable...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0110
rows.name: You catch on fast...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0111
rows.name:
That's right! This machine takes
collectibles and raw Aux Cores and
refines them into something useful!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0112
rows.name:
Here's one you can have a go with. I've
been saving it up for this very occasion!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0113
rows.name:
Boss! Best not to think about
where he stash it!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0114
rows.name:
Yes, Tora's right about that... It's not
much good without collectibles,
though... Here.

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0115
rows.name:
Meh meh! He really have a lot stashed
away there...

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0116
rows.name:
You're good to go, Rex!
Refine it!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0117
rows.name: Got it!

rows.label: fev02_250_127_msg0118
rows.name:
And as soon as we're done, let's go and
look for some info about Nia!
